title: Add contact line in footer and extend page with additional content sections

requirements.text: Add a final line at the very end of the site (in the footer bottom area) that reads exactly: "For more information contact 9315576318".

quotes: In last write for more information contact 9315576318

acceptanceCriteria: The footer displays the new sentence exactly as provided, including the phone number.
The new line appears after the existing copyright line (i.e., it is the last line on the page).
No existing footer content (branding, quick links, notices) is removed.

requirements.text: Make the website "more long" by adding additional, meaningful content sections below the existing sections, implemented as new React section components and included in the page flow in frontend/src/App.tsx.
acceptanceCriteria: At least two new full-width sections are added as separate components under frontend/src/components/sections/ and rendered in App.tsx after the current last section (RequestChangeSection).
Each new section has a unique section id (for hash navigation) and uses consistent spacing/layout patterns (e.g., py-16/md:py-24 and scroll-mt-16) matching existing sections.
The new sections contain substantial English content relevant to the AirHealth/AQI educational topic (not placeholder text).

requirements.text: Update site navigation to include the newly added sections: add corresponding items to the header navigation (desktop + mobile) and the footer “Quick Links” list, using the same smooth-scroll behavior as existing links.
acceptanceCriteria: SiteHeader navigation includes new buttons that scroll smoothly to each new section.
SiteFooter “Quick Links” includes new links that scroll smoothly to each new section.
All new links work from both desktop and mobile navigation without page reloads.

requirements.text: Extend the “Request a Change” form’s “Related Section” dropdown to include the newly added section names so users can reference them when submitting change requests.
acceptanceCriteria: The “Related Section” Select includes entries for each newly added section.
Submitting a change request still includes the selected section in the request body as it does today.
No regression to authentication/login flow for submitting change requests.

constraints: Do not publish/deploy changes without explicit user confirmation (user said: "Sorry don't publish").
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing UI components instead).
Keep all user-facing text in English.
nonGoals: No backend (Motoko) changes are required for this request.
No changes to Internet Identity authentication behavior.
No new third-party integrations (analytics, maps, social APIs, etc.).
